A basic implementation of this interface is provided in , but callers are free to provide their own implementation, for example, to load BCE credentials from an encrypted file.

member.name: T:BaiduBce.Auth.SignOptions
member.summary:
Options for signing the request.
There are 3 options available:
Option Description
headersToSign The set of headers to be signed. If this option is not set or set to null, only the following headers are signed
Host
Content-Length
Content-Type
Content-MD5
All headers starts with "x-bce-"
timestamp The time when the signature was created. If this option is not set or set to null, the signer will use the time when the sign method is invoked.
expirationInSeconds The time until the signature will expire, which starts from the timestamp. By default, it is set to 1800 (half an hour).
*

member.summary: The time until the signature will expire.

member.summary: The default sign options, which is {headersToSign:null, timestamp:null, expirationInSeconds:1800}.

member.name: T:BaiduBce.BceClientBase
member.summary:
Abstract base class for BCE service clients.
Responsible for basic client capabilities that are the same across all BCE SDK Java clients (ex: setting the client endpoint).
Subclass names should be in the form of "com.baidubce.services.xxx.XxxClient", while "xxx" is the service ID and "Xxx" is the capitalized service ID.

member.name: T:BaiduBce.BceServiceException
member.summary:
Extension of BceClientException that represents an error response returned by a BCE service. Receiving an exception of this type indicates that the caller's request was correctly transmitted to the service, but for some reason, the service was not able to process it, and returned an error response instead.
BceServiceException provides callers several pieces of information that can be used to obtain more information about the error and why it occurred. In particular, the errorType field can be used to determine if the caller's request was invalid, or the service encountered an error on the server side while processing it.

member.name: P:BaiduBce.BceServiceException.RequestId
member.summary: The unique BCE identifier for the service request the caller made. The BCE request ID can uniquely identify the BCE request, and is used for reporting an error to BCE support team.

member.name: P:BaiduBce.BceServiceException.ErrorCode
member.summary: The BCE error code represented by this exception.

member.name: P:BaiduBce.BceServiceException.ErrorMessage
member.summary: The error message as returned by the service.

member.name: P:BaiduBce.BceServiceException.StatusCode
member.summary: The HTTP status code that was returned with this error.

member.summary: convert HttpWebResponse to BceServiceException
member.param: the input HttpWebResponse

member.name: T:BaiduBce.BceClientException
member.summary:
Base exception class for any errors that occur on the client side when attempting to access a BCE service API.
For example, there is no network connection available or the network request is timeout, or the server returns an invalid response that the client is unable to parse, etc
Error responses from services will be handled as BceServiceExceptions.

member.name: M:BaiduBce.Services.Bos.BosClient.DoesBucketExist(System.String)
member.summary:
Checks if the specified bucket exists. Bos buckets are named in a global namespace; use this method to determine if a specified bucket name already exists, and therefore can't be used to create a new bucket.
If invalid security credentials are used to execute this method, the client is not able to distinguish between bucket permission errors and invalid credential errors, and this method could return an incorrect result.
member.param: The name of the bucket to check.
member.returns: The value true if the specified bucket exists in Bos; the value false if there is no bucket in Bos with that name.

If invalid security credentials are used to execute this method, the client is not able to distinguish between bucket permission errors and invalid credential errors, and this method could return an incorrect result.
member.param: The request object containing all options for checking a Bos bucket.
member.returns: The value true if the specified bucket exists in Bos; the value false if there is no bucket in Bos with that name.

member.name: M:BaiduBce.Services.Bos.BosClient.GetBucketAcl(System.String)
member.summary:
Gets the ACL for the specified Bos bucket.
Each bucket and object in Bos has an ACL that defines its access control policy. When a request is made, Bos authenticates the request using its standard authentication procedure and then checks the ACL to verify the sender was granted access to the bucket or object. If the sender is approved, the request proceeds. Otherwise, Bos returns an error.
member.param: The name of the bucket whose ACL is being retrieved.
member.returns: The GetBuckeetAclResponse for the specified Bos bucket.

member.name: M:BaiduBce.Services.Bos.BosClient.GetBucketAcl(BaiduBce.Services.Bos.Model.BucketRequestBase)

When a request is made, Bos authenticates the request using its standard authentication procedure and then checks the ACL to verify the sender was granted access to the bucket or object. If the sender is approved, the request proceeds. Otherwise, Bos returns an error.
member.param: The request containing the name of the bucket whose ACL is being retrieved.
member.returns: The GetBuckeetAclResponse for the specified Bos bucket.

member.name: M:BaiduBce.Services.Bos.BosClient.AbortMultipartUpload(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Aborts a multipart upload. After a multipart upload is aborted, no additional parts can be uploaded using that upload ID. The storage consumed by any previously uploaded parts will be freed. However, if any part uploads are currently in progress, those part uploads may or may not succeed. As a result, it may be necessary to abort a given multipart upload multiple times in order to completely free all storage consumed by all parts.
member.param: The name of the bucket containing the multipart upload to abort.
The key of the multipart upload to abort.
The ID of the multipart upload to abort.

As a result, it may be necessary to abort a given multipart upload multiple times in order to completely free all storage consumed by all parts.
member.param: The AbortMultipartUploadRequest object that specifies all the parameters of this operation.

member.name: T:BaiduBce.Services.Bos.Model.ListMultipartUploadsRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters of the ListMultipartUploads operation.
Required Parameters: BucketName

member.name: P:BaiduBce.Services.Bos.Model.ListMultipartUploadsRequest.Prefix
member.summary: Optional parameter restricting the response to multipart uploads for keys which begin with the specified prefix. You can use prefixes to separate a bucket into different sets of keys in a way similar to how a file system uses folders.

member.name: P:BaiduBce.Services.Bos.Model.ListMultipartUploadsRequest.KeyMarker
member.summary:
The optional key marker indicating where in the results to begin listing.
Together with the upload ID marker, specifies the multipart upload after which listing should begin.
If the upload ID marker is not specified, only the keys lexicographically greater than the specified key-marker will be included in the list.
If the upload ID marker is specified, any multipart uploads for a key equal to the key-marker may also be included, provided those multipart uploads have upload IDs lexicographically greater than the specified marker.

member.name: P:BaiduBce.Services.Bos.Model.ListMultipartUploadsRequest.Delimiter
member.summary: Optional parameter that causes multipart uploads for keys that contain the same string between the prefix and the first occurrence of the delimiter to be rolled up into a single result element. These rolled-up keys are not returned elsewhere in the response. The most commonly used delimiter is "/", which simulates a hierarchical organization similar to a file system directory structure.

member.name: P:BaiduBce.Services.Bos.Model.ListMultipartUploadsRequest.MaxUploads
member.summary: The optional maximum number of uploads to return.

member.name: P:BaiduBce.Services.Bos.Model.ListMultipartUploadsResponse.KeyMarker
member.summary: The optional key marker specified in the original request to specify where in the results to begin listing multipart uploads.

member.summary: The optional prefix specified in the original request to limit the returned multipart uploads to those for keys that match this prefix.

member.name: P:BaiduBce.Services.Bos.Model.ListMultipartUploadsResponse.Delimiter

member.name: M:BaiduBce.Services.Bos.Model.GetObjectRequest.SetRange(System.Int64,System.Int64)
member.summary:
Sets the optional inclusive byte range within the desired object that will be downloaded by this request.
The first byte in an object has position 0; as an example, the first ten bytes of an object can be downloaded by specifying a range of 0 to 9.
If no byte range is specified, this request downloads the entire object from Baidu Bos.

The end of the inclusive byte range to download.

member.name: T:BaiduBce.Services.Bos.Model.GeneratePresignedUrlRequest
member.summary:
Contains options to generate a pre-signed URL for an Baidu BOS resource.
Pre-signed URLs allow clients to form a URL for an Baidu BOS resource and sign it with the current BCE security credentials. A pre-signed URL may be passed around for other users to access the resource without providing them access to an account's BCE security credentials.

member.summary: The HTTP method (GET, PUT, DELETE, HEAD) to be used in this request and when the pre-signed URL is used

member.summary: The optional Content-Type header that will be sent when the presigned URL is accessed

member.name: F:BaiduBce.Services.Bos.Model.GeneratePresignedUrlRequest.ContentMd5
member.summary: The optional Content-MD5 header that will be sent when the presigned URL is accessed

member.name: F:BaiduBce.Services.Bos.Model.GeneratePresignedUrlRequest.ExpirationInSeconds
member.summary: An optional expiration after which point the generated pre-signed URL will no longer be accepted by BOS. If not specified, a default value will be supplied.

member.name: F:BaiduBce.Services.Bos.Model.GeneratePresignedUrlRequest.RequestParameters
member.summary: An optional map of additional parameters to include in the pre-signed URL. Adding additional request parameters enables more advanced pre-signed URLs, such as accessing BOS's torrent resource for an object, or for specifying a version ID when accessing an object.

member.name: F:BaiduBce.Services.Bos.Model.GeneratePresignedUrlRequest.RequestHeaders

member.name: T:BaiduBce.Services.Bos.Model.ListObjectsRequest
member.summary: Contains options to return a list of summary information about the objects in the specified bucket. Depending on the request parameters, additional information is returned, such as common prefixes if a delimiter was specified. List results are always returned in lexicographic (alphabetical) order.

member.name: P:BaiduBce.Services.Bos.Model.ListObjectsRequest.Prefix
member.summary: Optional parameter restricting the response to keys which begin with the specified prefix. You can use prefixes to separate a bucket into different sets of keys in a way similar to how a file system uses folders.

member.name: P:BaiduBce.Services.Bos.Model.ListObjectsRequest.Marker
member.summary: Optional parameter indicating where in the bucket to begin listing. The list will only include keys that occur lexicographically after the marker.

member.name: P:BaiduBce.Services.Bos.Model.ListObjectsRequest.Delimiter
member.summary: Optional parameter that causes keys that contain the same string between the prefix and the first occurrence of the delimiter to be rolled up into a single result element. These rolled-up keys are not returned elsewhere in the response. The most commonly used delimiter is "/", which simulates a hierarchical organization similar to a file system directory structure.

member.name: P:BaiduBce.Services.Bos.Model.ListObjectsRequest.MaxKeys
member.summary: Optional parameter indicating the maximum number of keys to include in the response. Baidu Bos might return fewer than this, but will not return more. Even if maxKeys is not specified, Baidu Bos will limit the number of results in the response.

member.name: T:BaiduBce.Services.Bos.Model.ListObjectsResponse
member.summary: Contains the results of listing the objects in an Baidu Bos bucket. This includes a list of objects describing the objects stored in the bucket, a list of common prefixes if a delimiter was specified in the request, information describing if this is a complete or partial listing, and the original request parameters.

member.name: P:BaiduBce.Services.Bos.Model.ListObjectsResponse.BucketName
member.summary: The name of the Baidu Bos bucket containing the listed objects

member.name: P:BaiduBce.Services.Bos.Model.ListObjectsResponse.NextMarker
member.summary: The marker to use in order to request the next page of results - only populated if the isTruncated member indicates that this object listing is truncated

member.name: P:BaiduBce.Services.Bos.Model.ListObjectsResponse.IsTruncated
member.summary: Indicates if this is a complete listing, or if the caller needs to make additional requests to Baidu Bos to see the full object listing for an Bos bucket

member.name: P:BaiduBce.Services.Bos.Model.ListObjectsResponse.Prefix
member.summary: The prefix parameter originally specified by the caller when this object listing was returned

member.name: P:BaiduBce.Services.Bos.Model.ListObjectsResponse.Marker
member.summary: The marker parameter originally specified by the caller when this object listing was returned

member.name: P:BaiduBce.Services.Bos.Model.ListObjectsResponse.MaxKeys
member.summary: The maxKeys parameter originally specified by the caller when this object listing was returned

member.name: P:BaiduBce.Services.Bos.Model.ListObjectsResponse.Delimiter
member.summary: The delimiter parameter originally specified by the caller when this object listing was returned

member.name: P:BaiduBce.Services.Bos.Model.ListObjectsResponse.Contents
member.summary: A list of summary information describing the objects stored in the bucket.

member.name: P:BaiduBce.Services.Bos.Model.ListObjectsResponse.CommonPrefixes
member.summary: A list of the common prefixes included in this object listing - common prefixes will only be populated for requests that specified a delimiter.

member.name: T:BaiduBce.Services.Bos.Model.ObjectMetadata
member.summary: Represents the object metadata that is stored with Baidu Bos. This includes custom user-supplied metadata, as well as the standard HTTP headers that Baidu Bos sends and receives (Content-Length, ETag, Content-MD5, etc.).

member.name: P:BaiduBce.Services.Bos.Model.ObjectMetadata.UserMetadata
member.summary: Custom user metadata, represented in responses with the x-bce-meta- header prefix

member.name: P:BaiduBce.Services.Bos.Model.ObjectMetadata.BceContentSha256
member.summary: The SHA-256 of the object content.

member.name: P:BaiduBce.Services.Bos.Model.ObjectMetadata.ContentDisposition
member.summary: The optional Content-Disposition HTTP header, which specifies presentation information for the object such as the recommended filename for the object to be saved as.

member.name: P:BaiduBce.Services.Bos.Model.ObjectMetadata.ContentEncoding
member.summary: The optional Content-Encoding HTTP header specifying what content encodings have been applied to the object and what decoding mechanisms must be applied in order to obtain the media-type referenced by the Content-Type field.

member.name: P:BaiduBce.Services.Bos.Model.ObjectMetadata.ContentLength
member.summary: The Content-Length HTTP header indicating the size of the associated object in bytes.

member.name: P:BaiduBce.Services.Bos.Model.ObjectMetadata.ContentMd5
member.summary: The base64 encoded 128-bit MD5 digest of the associated object (content - not including headers) according to RFC 1864. This data is used as a message integrity check to verify that the data received by Baidu Bos is the same data that the caller sent.

member.name: P:BaiduBce.Services.Bos.Model.ObjectMetadata.ContentType
member.summary: The Content-Type HTTP header, which indicates the type of content stored in the associated object. The value of this header is a standard MIME type.

member.name: P:BaiduBce.Services.Bos.Model.ObjectMetadata.ETag
member.summary:
The hex encoded 128-bit MD5 digest of the associated object according to RFC 1864. This data is used as an integrity check to verify that the data received by the caller is the same data that was sent by Baidu Bos.
This field represents the hex encoded 128-bit MD5 digest of an object's content as calculated by Baidu Bos. The ContentMD5 field represents the base64 encoded 128-bit MD5 digest as calculated on the caller's side.

member.name: P:BaiduBce.Services.Bos.Model.ObjectMetadata.InstanceLength
member.summary: The physical length of the entire object stored in Bos. This is useful during, for example, a range get operation.

member.name: P:BaiduBce.Services.Bos.Model.ObjectMetadata.LastModified
member.summary: The value of the Last-Modified header, indicating the date and time at which Baidu Bos last recorded a modification to the associated object.

member.name: P:BaiduBce.Services.Bos.Model.ObjectMetadata.ContentRange
member.summary: The content range of object.

member.name: P:BaiduBce.Services.Bos.Model.ObjectMetadata.StorageClass
member.summary: storage class of object.

member.name: T:BaiduBce.Services.Bos.Model.BucketSummary
member.summary:
Represents an Baidu Bos bucket.
Every object stored in Baidu Bos is contained within a bucket. Buckets partition the namespace of objects stored in Baidu Bos at the top level. Within a bucket, any name can be used for objects. However, bucket names must be unique across all of Baidu Bos.
There are no limits to the number of objects that can be stored in a bucket. Performance does not vary based on the number of buckets used. Store all objects within a single bucket or organize them across several buckets.

member.name: P:BaiduBce.Services.Bos.Model.BucketSummary.Name
member.summary: The name of this Baidu Bos bucket.

member.name: P:BaiduBce.Services.Bos.Model.BucketSummary.CreationDate
member.summary: The date this bucket was created.

member.name: P:BaiduBce.Services.Bos.Model.BucketSummary.Location
member.summary: The location of this Baidu Bos bucket.

member.name: T:BaiduBce.Services.Bos.Model.Grantee
member.summary: Represents the grantee of an Baidu Bos bucket.

member.name: P:BaiduBce.Services.Bos.Model.Grantee.Id
member.summary: The ID of the grantee.

member.name: T:BaiduBce.Services.Bos.Model.PutObjectRequest
member.summary:
Uploads a new object to the specified Baidu Bos bucket. The PutObjectRequest optionally uploads object metadata and applies a canned access control policy to the new object.
Baidu Bos never stores partial objects; if during this call an exception wasn't thrown, the entire object was stored.

member.name: P:BaiduBce.Services.Bos.Model.PutObjectRequest.FileInfo
member.summary: The file containing the data to be uploaded to Baidu Bos. You must either specify a file or an InputStream containing the data to be uploaded to Baidu Bos.

member.name: P:BaiduBce.Services.Bos.Model.PutObjectRequest.Stream
member.summary: The InputStream containing the data to be uploaded to Baidu Bos. You must either specify a file or an InputStream containing the data to be uploaded to Baidu Bos.

member.name: P:BaiduBce.Services.Bos.Model.PutObjectRequest.ObjectMetadata
member.summary: Optional metadata instructing Baidu Bos how to handle the uploaded data (e.g. custom user metadata, hooks for specifying content type, etc.). If you are uploading from an InputStream, you should always specify metadata with the content size set, otherwise the contents of the InputStream will have to be buffered in memory before they can be sent to Baidu Bos, which can have very negative performance impacts.

member.name: T:BaiduBce.Services.Bos.Model.PutObjectResponse
member.summary: Contains the data returned by Baidu Bos from the putObject operation. Use this request to access information about the new object created from the putObject request, such as its ETag and optional version ID.

member.name: P:BaiduBce.Services.Bos.Model.PutObjectResponse.ETAG
member.summary: The ETag value of the new object
